item.title: ::master ::pure
item.dc:creator: @chri55w chri55w
item.description:
@chri55w wrote:

okay maybe i messed that one up lol (wrote it off top of my head, besides only been coding a few months lol) you guys arent much support to him at lease i try and help lol, however this may work?

if(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && c.playerRights >= 1) { if (c.inWild() && c.playerRights == 1) return; if (c.arenas() && c.playerRights == 1) return; for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) { if ((c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) && c.playerRights == 1) { c.sendMessage("Please remove all your equipment before using this command."); return; } } for (int i = 0; i < 21; i++) { c.playerLevel[i] = 99; c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100); c.getPA().refreshSkill(i); c.getPA().requestUpdates(); } }

will check if player is in wilderness/duel arena and also if wielding items therefore making them unequip items to use the command

Read full topic

item.title: ::master ::pure
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“chri55w, post:4, topic:386169”]^ dont remove that line all it does is update the level when you use the command other wise it wouldnt show levels until you logged out.

add an if statement that checks if you already have the levels, if so tell it to return:

if ((c.getPA().getLevelForXp(0) && c.getPA().getLevelForXp(1) && c.getPA().getLevelForXp(2) && c.getPA().getLevelForXp(3) && c.getPA().getLevelForXp(4) && c.getPA().getLevelForXp(5) && c.getPA().getLevelForXp(6)) >= 99) { c.sendMessage("You do not need to use ::master"); return; }

i think this will work lol, havent tested it but it should do, if not and u cant figure out the errors then pm me
im sure you can figure out the ::pure one from this[/quote]
Use a for loop

Read full topic

item.title: ::master ::pure
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

arham 4:

I’m a beginner and I think you delete c.getPA().refreshSkill(i);. Copy it before you do it though, and the compile it. If an error shows just put back c.getPA().refreshSkill(i);.

Why would deleting an invoked method throw an error?

[quote=“chri55w, post:4, topic:386169”]^ dont remove that line all it does is update the level when you use the command other wise it wouldnt show levels until you logged out.

add an if statement that checks if you already have the levels, if so tell it to return:

if ((c.getPA().getLevelForXp(0) && c.getPA().getLevelForXp(1) && c.getPA().getLevelForXp(2) && c.getPA().getLevelForXp(3) && c.getPA().getLevelForXp(4) && c.getPA().getLevelForXp(5) && c.getPA().getLevelForXp(6)) >= 99) { c.sendMessage("You do not need to use ::master"); return; }

i think this will work lol, havent tested it but it should do, if not and u cant figure out the errors then pm me
im sure you can figure out the ::pure one from this[/quote]
u srs? or stupid?

item.title: ::master ::pure
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I suggest you just remove those commands; they don’t ever support large communities (from what I know, that is)

If they have access to those commands, the only thing you can do is add a timer so they cant use it a certain time during/after combat.

Read full topic

item.title: ::master ::pure
item.dc:creator: @Zatko Zatko
item.description:
@Zatko wrote:

hey, well i have the commands working and all and they cant use it in wildy but when they kill mobs it heals there hp everytime they use ::master or ::pure here is my command
if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“master”)) {
if (!c.inWild())
for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++) {
c.playerLevel[i] = 99;
c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100);
c.getPA().refreshSkill(i);
}
c.getPA().requestUpdates();
}

                    if (playerCommand.startsWith("pure")) {
                            if (!c.inWild())		
			c.getPA().addSkillXP((13500000), 4);
                            c.getPA().addSkillXP((800000), 5);
			c.getPA().addSkillXP((13500000), 6);
                            c.getPA().addSkillXP((13500000), 2);
                            c.getPA().addSkillXP((2000000), 0);
			c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
			c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]);
			c.getPA().refreshSkill(3);
                    }

Read full topic
